summary: The Expanding Regional Airports Act aims to improve passenger and flight capacity at underserved airports. It establishes a grant program under the Secretary of Transportation for eligible airports, defined as general aviation or nonprimary commercial service airports serving communities of at least 75,000 people. Grants can be used for various improvements, including expanding screening facilities, runway lengthening, and improving passenger facilities. The bill authorizes $50 million annually for the program.
